title: At what age do children start forming memories, nostalgia, and such? - Quora

response.answer_text: Judging by the early reactions that babies seem to have, they may recognize the smells of their mothers and fathers very early, which may well likely be a quite primitive instinct. Since very young babies quickly develop some desire or affection for certain stuffed animals at a few months, and that may be an indication of ‘memory’. Whether nostalia can be separated at this age, I cannot say. Just never lose the favorite stuffed animal, or help the child get used to 2–3 ‘favorite animals…

I remember things from I was 2 years old. But I don’t know when somemone begins to remember things. Most of the time people remember things from a very young age that affected them a lot. I had childhood abuse at that time.
